content: at the end of the row join in the round and place a marker at the bog now you have 68 78 stitches you might have to switch to shorter circular needles knit 5 cm stockinette in the round switch to 4 5 mm needles and work k1 p1 for 2 cm or until the ribbing reaches the desired length bind of loosely using the italian bind o cid 431 method face ribbing pick up and knit 106 116 stitches starting from the right corner of the chin with 4 5 mm needles 40 cm 16 inches you need to pick up 33 35 on each of the sides of the face 2 stitches for every 3 row pick up 19 20 stitches on the co edge at the forehead and the chin join in the round and place a marker at the bog k1 p1 for two row now to make the holes for the ties knit 90 98 stitches in k1 p1 then yo k2tog knit 8 stitches yo k2tog then finish the rest of the row continue to knit the rest of the ribbing k1 p1 in the round until it measures 6 cm from the edge bind of using the italian bind of method and sew the bind o cid 431 edge to the ws of the balaclava where the stitches were picked up making the tie to make the tie for the balaclava knit an i-cord this is done by casting on 3 stitches repeat steps until the i-cord measures 85-95 cm use a safety pin to thread the cord through the ribbing around the face final steps sew in all the ends wash the balaclava and dry flat slows stu cid 431 knitwear helensophie @ slowstu cid 431 knitwear com ©copyright 2024 tiktok @helensophieb // instagram @slowstu cid 431 knitwear this guide is for personal non-commercial use only the guide may not be resold share your version of the moose balaclava on instagram or tiktok with #moosebalaclava #slowstu cid 431 knitwear happy knitting
